intro: Melaleuca fulgens subsp. fulgens, commonly known as the golden myrtle, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It is characterized by its slender, often multi-stemmed shrub form and its striking, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant produces small, leathery leaves that are typically arranged in opposite pairs along the stems. Its flowers are typically borne in dense, cylindrical spikes, and it is well adapted to coastal and sandy soils. Melaleuca fulgens subsp. fulgens is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
